website_summaries.verdict: Gives competitors a run for their money with a comfortable footrest and just about all the features found in pricier models.
pros: Footrest gives kiddos ample room to put their feet up
Removable headrest and waist bar keep little ones comfortable and safe
Comes with a parent tray with for essentials
Foot brake prevents rolling when it's time for a rest
cons: No padding for the infant seat
Parent cup holder tips drinks when turning

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Super cute and well made. It bigger than I thought which is great. My one year old will grow with it.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, poor design
customer_reviews.text: This tricycle seemed to check all of the boxes. Purchased for my daughter’s first birthday. She is now 2 yrs old with 3 yr old twin brothers. None of them can ride this tricycle. It is heavy, challenging to pedal, even downhill, and difficult to steer. They much prefer an older smart trike we have that is lighter and much easier to pedal and steer. This seems like a great concept, but is just not well designed. Has been a complete waste of money and garage space.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Just put this together. Instructions were crap! Tools not labeled. Once assembled I placed my 1yr old in it and it leans to the left. No clue how to fix this and makes me uncomfortable taking her out. She seems to like it. Top tray keeps coming off. And steering is not as simple as it looks. I was so excited to receive this for her. Stalked my UPS man all day for it. Just disappointing in the quality. I expected better
customer_reviews.author: Lyndi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love it, it’s much easier to carry out than the baby scroller. My only problem was with the controls, the handle is loose which means when you turn it left or right, it takes a while for the bike to go in that direction. That problem may be on me for not installing right, I dont know yet. But other than that it’s very good, my kid loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Patience Filmore

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well.
customer_reviews.text: Terribly designed. First: the handle was so loose that I could barely drive it. Second: the handle just finally snapped off after about a year. Third: when I took the handle off completely the bike doesn’t even work. My seven year old can’t peddle it. It’s too difficult to actually make the pedals go around. My neighbor has the radio flyer version which works great. I watch her kid riding around all by herself all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worst assembly and written directions of a product
customer_reviews.text: Such a waste of time and aggravation. This tricycle looked so easy to put together on the website. All the holes to put the screws and bolts in were either to small or didn’t line up. The wheels don’t go together as stated in directions. After hours of attempts to put it together I decided to return it. They should pay me for how Long it took to put it back in the box to return. Worst purchase I’ve ever made for my granddaughter
customer_reviews.author: kimberly bellmer

customer_reviews.title: Great Grandson loves it
customer_reviews.text: Was a little difficult putting it together. It took the 2 us to put it together. It could use a little padding around the neck area and the top accessory holder does not stay on no matter what I do. It would be nice if it screwed on, also one of the little break pads on the wheel locks on it's own every so often. I love the idea that he can grow into it and use it by himself in the future, and our little one seems to enjoy his rides.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. We had one like this before but a different brand. Putting it together was not that bad. The hardest part was probably putting in the wheels. Other than that it was easy. The steering a really good and the handle for the adults is adjustable so it is for various heights. The only thing that I can think that is negative is the cup holder for the person pushing the trike. When you turn the handle it feels as though the cup will fall out but won't. There are 4 silicone tabs that keep the cup in place.
customer_reviews.author: Phi T.

customer_reviews.title: Not at all sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first bad review for an Amazon product. I bought this little tikes as a surprise gift for my toddler kid for her 2nd birthday and It turned out to be really bad choice. The 1st day we assembled, it looked like it was leaning to one side, after a week we tried to reassemble it again, yet it looks the same, like it's going to fall/trip over to one side. While we were riding with my daughter in it, I took a turn and the trike almost tripped to fall to side it was leaning and itscared the hell out of me. This happened almost twice. I will not at all suggest this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: iPras

customer_reviews.title: Annoying to push
customer_reviews.text: We were so excited to get this for our 17 month old son. We are always outside waking, biking or riding. We thought this would be the next step up from his car that we push him in. Unfortunately for some reason it’s hard to push! It’s like the brakes are on (obviously they aren’t). My husband is mechanically minded and put it together. It’s not the assembly that is the problem it’s the design that makes this tricycle annoying to push. We won’t be using it at all. I hope Amazon will work with me on a return.
customer_reviews.author: FlyingHigh

customer_reviews.title: A cool stroller trike
customer_reviews.text: This is a great trike stroller combo that we will use for more than 1 year! Since we assembled it, I take my son out in it everyday. In our hot climate, I am grateful for the canopy and 2 water bottle holders. It is easier to push a regular stroller than this, but he looks like the coolest kid on the block and I can use the exercise. The diagrams are a little confusing for assembly, so find a video online for assembly.
customer_reviews.author: V. Payne

customer_reviews.title: Smart concept at reasonable price !
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this ! My baby is not a fan of the stroller. She wants to be able to see everything around her and the stroller definitely doesn't give her that so I decided to give this a try and we love this ! Assembling this wasn't that hard. It took me probably 45 mins and everything was clear in the instruction book. The wheels are plastic so I really don't know how long they will last. But since it is meant to grow with my baby I would hope they are made to last. Very smooth to push Cons: It's a little big to carry with you in the car when you travel.
customer_reviews.author: Thuy

customer_reviews.title: Defective piece!
customer_reviews.text: This bike had an internal piece that is defective, which I noticed while I was putting it together, so I am unable to finish. I followed the directions exactly as they were listed and still encountered this issue. I bought this back in Novemeber as a Christmas gift for my daughter but decided to keep it a few months to give as a birthday gift, so unfortunately I have missed the window to return.
customer_reviews.author: John Pullman

customer_reviews.title: Cute, Fun, Sturdy and easy to push!
customer_reviews.text: This is the cutest trike! it was a little difficult to put together and took some time, but it is well worth it. My 17 month old granddaughter LOVES it. It is sturdy and very easy to steer and push around. nice sun shade as they live in Las Vegas. Cup holder and basket. My only wish would have been a storage bag of some sort that when they child grows and you want to take it down to a single trike you can keep all the parts and instructions. together. Very Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gram

customer_reviews.title: Give me a break!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on August 7 for my Granddaughter's 2nd Birthday which is Sept. 13th, as soon as my Daughter listed it on Amazon as a desired gift item. She received two of these. The return date expired September 12th!! Really!! No return. You are great but this is BS considering the circumstances. I just want a gift card to give to her in exchange for the return. UN-Happy in Houston
customer_reviews.author: Windman

customer_reviews.title: Best money spent all year
customer_reviews.text: Everything i wanted in a bike and more! My daughter is almost 2 and its a perfect fit! Took only 30 mins to assemble (not sure why other reviewers are having trouble) and its SUPER STURDY very well made. I feel like shell be safe no matter where we go. Maneuverability is a breeze and an added plus is the steering bar is long enough so that my 6"4 husband can push her comfortably too! Win win! Thanks so much for make such a great product
customer_reviews.author: keke

customer_reviews.title: Bike is impossible to ride.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. It worked well as a stroller, despite a bit of unstable steering. I am most disappointed in the fact that my now 3.5 year old still can't get the pedals to work enough to ride. As a matter of fact, my now 5.5 year old, who's been riding a bike for three years now, has been unable to ride the bike. The pedals being attached to the front wheel makes it impossible to ride as a bike which is what I wanted from this product. I do not recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Chris R.

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have bought it sooner!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our two year who was not want to explore the neighborhood in her stroller or wagon anymore. Pretty easy assembly, she can't fully reach the pedals yet but the foot rest is perfect while we push and steer. She can partially override the steering but we just have to turn back to intended direction. I wish we would have bought it a year ago for even more use.
customer_reviews.author: stevew112

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible quality. I have to keep the handle turned to the left just in order to stay straight while pushing my son. If I need to turn left I have to turn the handle completely to the left to where the handle is vertical making it impossible to use the drink and item holder on the handle. Can’t even use it for what I need. Also my older son tried to use the petas and the switch keeps swinging back making the wheels stop turning. And yes we slid the switch just how the instructions said to. It’s a piece of crap made mostly of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: hsapough

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy or as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to stear for person pushing it. If I put my drink in the cup holder it definitely will spill every turn. Baby can steer and pusher can steer so my toddler tries to take us off the side walk often. It's not as simple for me as the advertisement says it will be. The handle is wobbly and weak. I should have sent it back when I had the chance.#notforeveryone
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Somers

customer_reviews.title: Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: The product came on time. And very easy to install, just takes time, of course. But looks like my the sit is small to my 20 months old baby. Will see in the future soon. And love the color and trays.
customer_reviews.author: Amara Derya

customer_reviews.title: Best Bike/Stroller for my daughter.
customer_reviews.text: My Daughter loves her new Tricycle Stroller, it took me some time to put it together " 3 Hours" but when i was done my daughter wanted to try it so bad that in one picture i still was going to put the Canopy but she wanted it so bad to go for a ride that the canopy had to wait
customer_reviews.author: Ader Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: My 9 month old son loves his trike!
customer_reviews.text: I’m taking off a star for the assembly, and the wheel lock/brake feature. The wheels can lock up over time and you have to play around with the tightness of assembly. Can’t be too tight nor too loose to get maximum roll. Really other than that this is great for the younger tyke under a year old. Not sure how it’ll hold up down the road once he’s really pedaling and on his own, but I’ll worry about that then.
customer_reviews.author: Sean on Long Island

customer_reviews.title: Defective toy!!! Waste of time and could not use it!
customer_reviews.text: Defective. First off the front wheel never locked into place with the stated “snap” on directions. So it now sits there very unsafe. Now the parent handlebar doesn’t line up the holes are defective and misaligned metal part. So now we can’t use it completely waste! Leaving disappointed Lisa and upset and frustrated mommy! (Dads deployed)
customer_reviews.author: Neil m.

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy enough.
customer_reviews.text: My son is 2 year old now, about 37 in. But he can’t peddle yet because the height and length of the tricycle. It shows 2+ should be able to peddle, my son is taller than the same age toddlers though. And the parents handle is not that sturdy, hard to control. But the quality of the product is okay for the price. Wish it’s more sturdy then I’ll definitely give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M

customer_reviews.title: Can not recommend
customer_reviews.text: It took my fiancé almost three hours to assemble because the holes and screws were not aligned. It is not very sturdy. When I push my 22 pound baby in it, it feels like there’s some resistance. I cannot push it with ease for a brisk walk. Definitely do not recommend. If it wasn’t such a pain to take it apart, I’d be sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: My 9 month old loves riding in this! Nice to have the tray at the top for me and one for him as well. I'm 5'9" and can comfortable push at the highest setting for the handle. Light and easy to push! Easy to put together with a drill, took maybe an hour and didn't even need my husband's help. I like that the canopy can be pushed forward or backward to block the sun, no matter which direction you turn. We've been using it for about a month and haven't had any problems come up. Very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great for littles
customer_reviews.text: My 16 month old is obsessed with her trike. My only qualms are that the shoulder straps are a little loose on her so she can wiggle out and the adult push handle seems flimsy. Plus if you have anything in the adult cup holder of the handle and turn the trike, everything will spill out.
customer_reviews.author: M and R

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and wonderful how easy it changes
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and wonderful how easy it changes. We've been able to take apart based on our son's wants. Harder to push than a stroller, but very manageable. Easy to steer. Kiddo is on the shorter side and he can reach the pedals. Nice to have a place for a water bottle. Hoping it continues to meet expectations as it grows with child.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to assemble, the handle bar hole wont align..
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little bike when my son was about 6 months hoping he would be able to ride in it by the time he's 1. He's turning 1 in 2 week sand I was trying to put this together for him. It's not the easy to assemble it. However, I toughed it out until the last piece - the handle bar. I tried so hard to jam it down the opening and put the safety in. The holes just wont align!!! I did that for about an hour and I gave up. I requested for a replacement handle bar/unit. If that doesn't work, I guess my little one who be riding it until he's like 2!
customer_reviews.author: Juanita Wong

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son's 1st birthday present. He loves it, he enjoys the riding around outside. I love that it has cupholders for me and him. I love that I am able to turn from my handle and the breaks as well. I really cant say anything bad about it. It was a little bit of a pain to put together but what isnt? I would buy this again and recommend to anyone with a little one too little to actually ride but wants to be outside or with their older siblings!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Read the reviews, hard to attach handle.
customer_reviews.text: Almost impossible to attach the handle. Customer service rep was on the phone with us for 20 minutes while 3 people struggled to attach it. The service rep was ready to send a new handle if necessary. Sounds like it must be a common occurrence. That being said, it’s a nice idea but it’s hard to steer. It needs a different type of handle. Shop around, there are other ride on trikes out there.
customer_reviews.author: Gramma

customer_reviews.title: Great set up!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this about 3 months and used it indoors and out. It has held up pretty well so far but I do have my doubts about the pushing bar reliability. It can be difficult to steer. I hope the transitions to trike only will be smooth! We don’t regret purchasing and will see how reliable it ends up. We get tons of compliments whenever we are out using it. It really is nifty. The blue color is very striking. I love the adult cup holder tray. Perfect for a seltzer and iPhone. THe child tray holds crackers and a clip on toy.
customer_reviews.author: EasyBreezySunflower

customer_reviews.title: Superior to a stroller
customer_reviews.text: This thing is just COOL. It’s fun to put my niece in it and just go. I can see/hear her (unlike in the stroller) and I like to put little snacks or candies in the little tray in front of her. She massively enjoys our walks in this thing. She used to sort of get fussy and kick off in the stroller, but not in this thing. And the best part is that it’s going to grow with her! She’ll eventually be riding circles around me later on this same trike and that’s pretty cool.
customer_reviews.author: Machias Grey

customer_reviews.title: Love this for my little granddaughter and myself
customer_reviews.text: Love this for my little granddaughter and myself! It's perfect for what we need right now. she thinks she is steering and i'm comfortable at the back steering from my handlebar without hunching over or struggling. the little sun cover is just enough that i can still see her but she's covered. she has foot rests and a safety rail so she can stand up and sing! or sit down and take in the sights. can't quite reach the pedals yet, which is great since she's too little to get how to peddle. she's 19 months.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen M. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Not stable or safe.
customer_reviews.text: Not able to full tighten dow. The seat leans to the right, forcing my toddler to sit to the right. You spend the entire walk correcting the direction, because it wants to go to the right. We tightened everything down and it is all loose and feels like it will just fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Jenniebear

customer_reviews.title: My 2 yr old Grand-daughter absolutely LOVES this bike
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bike for my grand-daughter who wanted to ride bikes w/ the other children in our neighborhood. It was not the easiest thing to assemble but was able to do it by myself. My GD absolutely loves to ride on the bike (she is a little too short yet to reach the peddles so we use the handle to push her on it) The bike does have alot of great features, seat moves forward and back a great distance, baskets and cup holders for the adult pushing the bike. Very happy with my choice
customer_reviews.author: JOELLEN

customer_reviews.title: Great for short walks, and getting kid used to a trike!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my daughter for her first birthday, and she absolutely loves it. I do love that it grows with her. Right now, she sits in it and moves the handles back and forth while we maneuver it from the back lever. While she enjoys riding it, I am giving it four stars because it is a bit difficult to maneuver with the handle. Definitely good for short walks and walking on flat terrain, but if you plan to do major hills, you might want to stick with a stroller.
customer_reviews.author: KJo

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Back wheels are so tight barely can push it an no way to fix it
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Church

customer_reviews.title: Hard to assemble, DOES NOT TURN
customer_reviews.text: I'll start by saying this thing was a nightmare to assemble. The pieces don't just fit together like the instructions say. Some have to be forced together. It took me 2 hours to assemble. The handle is a joke. It doesn't turn at all unless the handle bar is turned completely sideways which count on everything in the cup holder area falling out. I was so excited to get this and I hate it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the best quality.
customer_reviews.text: This tricycle was fairly reasonable to put together but had a lot of steps. Quality is just barely OK. It has faded a lot after only a few months and already looks like its several years old even though I keep it in a shaded breezeway out of the weather. It's too late to send back and would be way too much hassle to dismantle and try to fit back in a box anyhow. I wish I had bought an old fashioned red metal one! I can't in all good conscience recommend this trike.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah K.P-W

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect learning trike for my daughter
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect learning trike for my daughter, she's 21 months. I actually could've bought this for her a year ago and it still would've been perfect since there's so much room to grow in it. It's safe, easy to use and only took me about 30 mins to put together. This will last us a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Little one loves it! Great 1st birthday gift!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my sons 1st birthday & he absolutely loves it. Weather was crummy 1st few days & he insisted on riding around the living room! First chance we got we took it outside. Love the adjustable height handle & cup holders. I like that the cup holder has the little tabs to keep your cup in place, but it won’t hold a very large cup 🤷🏻‍♀️. Also my son is on the shorter side (28”) and his feet don’t quite touch the feet rest but it doesn’t seem to bother him.
customer_reviews.author: JenniferA

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work out for us
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t maneuver as well as I would’ve hoped. My daughter got this bike when she was two. At three, she was riding a bike with training wheels... but, this bike for some reason is very hard for her to push. It’s a good bike to push a child in but as far as it growing with the child, it’s not working out. We don’t really have much of a use for it at this point
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Can't adjust height of seat
customer_reviews.text: Does not adjust enough for my daughter to reach the wheel and pedal independently. Move the seat all the way up and even pushed it back. It should have been made where the part that holds the seat can be adjusted as well to a higher and lower level. Since it is only made in a high position it becomes problematic for children who isnt super tall with long legs
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't fully assemble
customer_reviews.text: I spent HOURS putting this together. It was missing screws and some of the holes were stripped. Luckily I still had my older daughter's mostly broken one to take screws. When I got near finishing, I found I couldn't finish it because the handle is too long for the hole it fits into. I can't hook it in place. So frustrating! So now I have to take it all apart in order to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My kid loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My 16 month old LOVES this!! I bought it for her for Christmas. I love the fact that it is a 4 in 1. I did a version of 2-3-4, it is very versatile. Warning: this is one of the most challenging kids items I’ve had to build. If you’re getting it as a gift do yourself a favor and plan plenty of time to build it without kids around 😂 I do wish it was somewhat collapsible so it was easier to transport.
customer_reviews.author: Venus Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I truly do not understand the negative reviews of this toy! My husband easily put it together in about 45 minutes and my son absolutely loves it! He was grinning from ear to ear as we pushed him around the house for a test run. It's really easy to steer, easy to adjust from phase to phase and has so many great features! I highly recommend this tricycle stroller combo!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nerida

customer_reviews.title: A recommended buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived quick and it was a pleasure to assemble. The instructions were mostly pictures but once you put it together then its fun fun fun. Perfect for family walks in the park or even in your neighborhood... my daughter loves it!!!! Very easy to steer as well.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Great concept but major design flaw
customer_reviews.text: So... I absolutely love the concept of a trike-n-grow style bike. However, the handles need to be made to lock in place when little ones are being pushed. When they jerk and pull on the handle, it steers off track and could potentially be dangerous. I’m alway caution when cars drive by so we don’t accidentally steer in their direction.
customer_reviews.author: Scruggs

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Comfy Ride, & Grows with Baby!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely well made. Great quality. Easy to assemble. I love the foot rests for our 19 month old to keep her feet away from the pedals (for now). Sippy country is the perfect size. Straps are comfortable. Handle for pushing is height adjustable. We love this and love that it’ll grow with baby.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey H.

customer_reviews.title: Item color not as pictured
customer_reviews.text: I can’t find a place to send feedback to seller so I’m writing a review. I love the functionality of the product but I was disappointed that the colors weren’t as pictured. I bought the blue and white trike for my little girl but what was delivered was blue and dark grey. The blue and white was very unisex whereas the blue and dark grey seems very masculine. Not that I believe in gender color associations, it’s just not what was pictured. My parents assembled the trike and I didn’t see it until fully assembled and so cannot be bothered to un-assemble, re-box and return. Apart from that I’d give 5 stars to the product.
customer_reviews.author: Spannajo

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves it but it is unstable with the ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves it but it is unstable with the tray. Set my Note 5 in it and turned the corner and it fell out and my phone screen was done for. Went completely black. And the handle is very wobbily. I added a car seat buckle at the top as my 2yr old likes to climb out of the straps and stand up. If it werent for the tray falling out and breaking my phone i would have rated this 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: SyntheticMollie

customer_reviews.title: be prepared for a million pieces
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this stroller. Putting it together was WORK..be prepared when ordering. Also went out for a stroll and the wind picked up and actually knocked the stroller over with my son in it and the cupholder accessory flew off it was frightening but good thing he was strapped in. One thing to get used to when pushing is going up curbs on an angle it seems like it could flip over if you don't hold the handles at the right angle. But overall we enjoy this product. Cubbys are great for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Pearl

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I love the adult tray. It’s perfect for snacks drinks and phones. My son loves having his own control over steering. Only down side is no drain holes in bottom tray so you have to tip whole thing over to get water out. My husband just drilled couple tiny holes in bottom. Plus side you can take the adult tray off and bring it in so it doesn’t get dirty in the elements.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ) The idea of this trike is great, I love that it should last him for ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves riding on this trike. His legs aren't long enough yet to peddle himself. Be ready for some serious commitment to putting this thing together, one of those marriage testers ;) The idea of this trike is great, I love that it should last him for so long. However, this thing is seriously hard to push. We live in a paved neighborhood, but any sort of incline makes it feel like your pushing dead weight. I wonder how well a kiddo will be able to pedal themselves on this.
customer_reviews.author: Eah Waggs

customer_reviews.title: A little flimsier than I thought it would be and ...
customer_reviews.text: A little flimsier than I thought it would be and the parent steering wheel doesn't override the child steering so you have to fight them ha ha. It was also missing one or two non critical parts when it arrived. Nothing we couldn't make work but when you spend the money you want the whole thing at the start right?
customer_reviews.author: Amber D.

customer_reviews.title: Quality not as expected for a pretty expensive trike
customer_reviews.text: Not so happy with the quality of this trike, it gets really hard to push it after a while and the brake pedals are really cheap made and hard to use by foot; color not as nice as pictured I cannot push it for a long walk(more than 10 minutes), because it gives me lower back pain and my child is two and weight around 26 lbs, meanwhile I can push his stroller for hours and don’t feel any discomfort or pain.
customer_reviews.author: C.Con

customer_reviews.title: Overall good product, seems durable
customer_reviews.text: Took an hour to put together, instructions were ok. Minor manufacturing flaw, the plastic in the handle bar post wasn't smooth so I had to push with all my might to get it to fit. The trike has more rolling resistance and friction in the wheels than I would expect, so it is a workout for me to push my daughter around the neighborhood - 1+ miles. Overall good product, seems durable. The cellphone and water bottle holder in the top is useless because when you turn to steer, they'll all tilt and fall out. Use the bucket instead, as others have pointed out.
customer_reviews.author: achlvnv

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this bike! We mainly use it up and down our street. We looked for a long time and finally settled on this one. I’m not sure how long any of these would last if repeatedly going on long walks, as I’m sure the wheels would eventually wear out over time as they are a hard foam/plastic feel? But up and down the street strolls seems to work great!
customer_reviews.author: Chadwick

customer_reviews.title: As other reviewers noted, the directions for putting this ...
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers noted, the directions for putting this item together are not that clear. It took my husband and I about two hours to put it together (and I rarely have difficulty with these type of instructions). My 20 month-old daughter LOVES riding in it and has shown a lot of interest in trying to use the pedals. She is much more engaged and interested in her surroundings than when she is in the stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Keeping an Adventurous Toddler Safe
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 22-month-old daughter for Christmas and she LOVES it. The footrests are just the perfect size since she can't quite reach the peddles and it's so great to be able to control her movements with the handle at this age, yet allowing her to feel so independent. The ride seems smooth and the safety harness makes me feel more confident. I wish it tightened up just a little bit more as my girl is a skinny minny, but overall I've been happy with the design. I will try to update once she's older and can use it as a tricycle.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea S.

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy This!
customer_reviews.text: The price was right, but the parts were not. After spending over an hour carefully following assembly instructions I got to the handle bar (Part N), this fit into place just fine, but the holes were drilled in the wrong spot, it did not line up with holes on the base of the trike, and I was unable to put the lock (Part H), back to lock the handle bar into place. Extremely disappointed in this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: WhatTheSpeck?!?!?!

customer_reviews.title: the friction in the back wheels is TERRIBLE! There is no way she will ever have ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this a year ago and have used it consistently because my daughter loves it; however, the friction in the back wheels is TERRIBLE! There is no way she will ever have the strength to pedal this by herself and it is a chore to push it because there is so much resistance. My neighbor has a trike from another brand and I really wish we had researched more.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: Minor problems
customer_reviews.text: Minor problems, just as expected but my toddler still has the ability to steer so sometimes when she wants to drive like a mad women I have to try and keep it sturdy. Something weird is wrong with one of my wheels it wobbles even with all screws tightened.
customer_reviews.author: Lacy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this. But I was sent 2 right brakes which was a pain. But I was so I excited I proceeded with the assembly. Instructions are mostly pictures and few words with made it a little complicated to assemble. It feels ver flimsy not sturdy at all. Wouldn’t buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Natalie R.

customer_reviews.title: but for the price one expects better quality. I mean
customer_reviews.text: Meh... It's ok I guess, but for the price one expects better quality. I mean, it is cute and all, but just not the sturdy product I've come to know from Little Tikes. There is a lot of play in the steering. All of the plastic is pretty flimsy. Fresh out of the box there are lots of stress marks in different areas of the plastic. (you know, how it gets white right before it splits) I really can't see this lasting very long once the baby is older and can ride alone.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mudore

customer_reviews.title: Great trike for our son!
customer_reviews.text: Love this trike and so does our 14 month old. We bought it as a gift for his first birthday and so far it's really been great! I can't wait to see him grow into being able to pedal and steer it on his own. For now, the parent console is a plus and it steers very well. We tried out many different ones at the store prior to deciding on this one and Amazon offered the best price so we bought online. The only con is that it took a while to put together but it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Iza

customer_reviews.title: Assembly is impossible and cryptic
customer_reviews.text: This is singlehandedly the worst purchase I’ve ever made. Assembly: The hole in the bottom of the handle did not match up with the hole for assembly. Someone in a previous review said to turn the wheel to make the alignment. I did that - now the handle does not properly steer the front wheel. Miserable experience to put together and to drive.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Hind

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest
customer_reviews.text: It's not easy to ride at all. My son knows how to peddle but he is unable to peddle this bike. The wheels are too stiff I guess? It's not a smooth ride at all. We have still used it plenty as a stroller but it's not what I had hoped it would be. Radio flyer is much easier to use and even push as well
customer_reviews.author: Samatha

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: If you want to use this as a stroller go for it. But by the time your kid can reach the pedals on their own they will be ready to learn how to ride a 2 wheel bike. My girl is 2 and a half and can't reach the pedals and she's not short for her age. The girl on the box riding the trike is at least 6. What 6 year old is riding a trike.... they really should have made this smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Assembly wasn’t the easiest but the issue worth discussing is the cheaply feel to this product. For this to be a Little Tikes item especially, I find this to be cheaply manufactured. Lacks sturdiness. I spent very little on this product which is why I’m keeping it but if I spent over $40 on this id definitely return.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Did not work as expected - Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a year now and we've tried using it multiple times to no avail. The pedals are just too small and make the entire product worthless. There is only about 2 inches of length; so when he was younger he couldn't reach them even though he seemed tall enough. Now he can reach the pedals but cannot actually ride the bike because it's so difficult to push them around.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Meichsner

customer_reviews.title: lacks adjustability for child to reach pedals
customer_reviews.text: Main complaint is that the “adjustability factor” on this is bogus. You can move the seat up and down the diagonal bar, but none of these maneuvers functions to lessen the distance from your child’s feet to the pedals. Either they are “lower” down horizontally far from the pedal or, alternately, they are “higher up” but then vertically too far from the pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS!
customer_reviews.text: My girls love these bikes! I can't wait to take them for a walk. They are a little labor intensive to put together and I'm slightly worried about all the screws that adhere to the plastic. Hoping none get stripped out. There are so many adjustable options I am sure it will take us awhile to test them all out. The only small draw back is that the canopy can't be pushed completely backward, but it is removable.
customer_reviews.author: MaggieBAP

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!! Junk!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so upset with this product. I bought this for my son's birthday, so excited to get it put together. His father spent 3 long hours attempting to get it together, but a lot of the screws and parts were not manufactured correctly and very cheaply made!!! The seat was wobbly, the handle that you connect for the "stroller" part of it would not screw in because the screw wasn't even long enough to hook it up!! We are so disappointed, wasted time trying to get the stupid thing together and it's NOT worth $80. Better off spending more money on higher quality Radio Flyer bike, not Little Tikes.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is a cute bike but the quality is poor. The whole seat leans off to the side. My husband has tried to fix it and tighten it multiple times but it hasn’t helped. It makes me nervous for our daughter to sit on it. I thought the problem was just with our bike but we saw these at a toy store and they also had the same problem. Such a well known and trusted company should have a better product. Our neighbors have the same thing by a different brand and theirs is much better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Walker

customer_reviews.title: Lovely stroller. Annoying assembly
customer_reviews.text: I’m loving the stroller and so is my 15m son. Putting it together, however, was a huge annoyance! The trike feels somewhat flimsy, so I’m only riding it on sidewalks. Do no try off road adventures, or it might fall apart. Using fully assembled phase, so can’t vouch for pedaling use yet. We have taken it on trips to enjoy riding during the summer months. The teal color is very nice. One star removed for the assembly part...
customer_reviews.author: mmercer

customer_reviews.title: Works decently well, but a lot of "play" in the steering
customer_reviews.text: Overall not as good as expected, but being a 4-in-1 product I guess that is to be expected. Wouldn't buy again. The sunshade is a little finicky and not too useful.
customer_reviews.author: sara kalina

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to assemble , mis alaigned spare parts
customer_reviews.text: Light weight but here are the major concerns - assembly 3 hours - not able to fix front wheel correctly yet ( after 5 days ) - loose handles - storage bucket slips frequently - I am about to return it but the I am having hard time in de-assembly it - unable to put/ tight 3 screws as there is gap between two joints/ mis- aligned spare parts
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with our purchase
customer_reviews.text: I researched all kinds of trikes and went with this one primarily because it grows with our kid and had the footrest since she can't reach the pedals yet. Neighbors of ours have a similar trike in the Radio Flyer but they mentioned that since their child has nothing to rest their feet on they tend to dangle. Our daughter gets so excited when we go in the garage and she sees it. Also- love the overhead shade, the storage compartments, and the padded steering handle.
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle Undeland

customer_reviews.title: horrrible to assembly- glad I got them on sale
customer_reviews.text: Horrible to assembly - had to use some of our own screws to make sturdy. I go them half price on sale or I would have been mad - pretty cheap plastic but it is that little tykes plastic. Got 2 for son and daughter. Had to send the first one back and get a replacement bc it would not go together correctly waiting for the second to get there. daughter lines it though
customer_reviews.author: melissa williams

customer_reviews.title: Options to use for several years
customer_reviews.text: Great trike. Nice versatility & options to grow with child that can be used for several years. Very durable and plenty of features for mom and dad too!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry T.

customer_reviews.title: I get tons of compliments!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I use it almost everyday when I take my 14 month old for a walk. It's sturdy, rides smooth, and my son loves sitting in it. Everywhere we go people say how cool it is and ask where i purchased it from.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Magloire

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nifty
customer_reviews.text: It's simple and well designed. My daughter loves it and I like it. It's a little stiff to push compared to the stroller and turning can be a fickle at times but this this is worth the money. Great for watching her learn and grow into
customer_reviews.author: Dr Killanger

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4 months past warranty time frame, now can't replace!! ☹️
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a year and almost a half but the handle to turn and steer just broke so now we have no way of turning the trike. Pretty frustrating, 4 months past the warranty time frame!! Stuff isn't made to last anymore, pretty disappointing!!
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Not worth
customer_reviews.text: Not at all satisfied with this,i was about to buy radioflyer,but some how taught this might be sturdier and the footrest attracted me,but assembling takes all your energy and after done ,when you put your kid in it and start pushing,it starts wiggling ,I am scared that it might fall.not worth the price ,the trike Walmart sells might be the better option .
customer_reviews.author: Hhh

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My son loves taking walks with me while he rides his bike and i push... the handles are a bit low for my husband he is 6ft tall. Theyre ok for me and im 5’3 Handling the bike is a bit tough though if the toddler grabs one of the front handles
customer_reviews.author: Yesenia

customer_reviews.title: so worth the money
customer_reviews.text: i got this for my daughter's first birthday and she loves it the front can hold her cup and snacks and the sun is out of her eyes, great buy so worth the money, and the fact that it will grow with her is ever better she tries to put her feet on the pedals but doesn't know how to do it yet. she also likes to try to steer which way we are going to turn. i didn't understand why the pink one cost more than the teal one. but that's the only bad thing i can say about it. as the weather starts to cool down here in the south it will get used even more.
customer_reviews.author: YRD

customer_reviews.title: Works ok
customer_reviews.text: I spent hours to put them together. Some of the part are not easy to put together. The seat seemed not so stable but worked ok. "Needs a lot of effort to bike it" from my daughter. But all in all seems works out. Not too satisfied but ok with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: We were thrilled to make this purchase for our daughters first birthday! Since it was in December, we just finally started to use it this summer! While I love all everything about this item, we CAN NOT get the handle to turn to push her. It feels like it is stripped and will not allow us to push her in it???? It looked like such a great item and we are so sad that it is not usable!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Powell

customer_reviews.title: We have no choice, so using it for the ...
customer_reviews.text: We have no choice, so using it for the past 6 mo. Apart from being hard to assemble it is frustrating to maneuver the steering guide. The seat is not aligned, it has lost balance and toppled several times when trying to steer it in one direction causing my toddler to almost fall thank god for the harness which kind of works to some extent, but keeps falling apart from my toddlers shoulder even when buckled and secured. The back wheels are tight as many users have complained. My toddlers feet don't reach the pedals after adjusting the seat distance. All in all its not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Njchatt

customer_reviews.title: noise from the back wheels
customer_reviews.text: Hubby said it was painful to put together but he did it! It was very nice at first. Then after our first walk outside, I started to notice the wheels make noise. I can't find where the noise come from but it comes from the back wheels or from the axle. It is quite annoying, you need to tolerate the noise, when you just want to have a relaxing walk with your toddler :( If it gets worst, I will have to contact Amazon.com to schedule a return
customer_reviews.author: Y. Y. Chang

customer_reviews.title: Push bar dysfunctional/manufacture failure.
customer_reviews.text: It took me several hours to assemble because instructions were awful. I got it all done- and the the push bar did not fit!!! I was so angry because that was one of the main reason we liked this bike for our special needs daughter. It was absolutely frustrating that I had it all the way put together before realizing the factory/manufacturer screwed up this part!!! We sent it back. Afterward we saw others that had the same issue. Ridiculous that the quality assurance and company continue to make this part dysfunctional!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M.

customer_reviews.title: Zero Stars..  get something better
customer_reviews.text: First it was difficult to push! Not parent friendly wen used it in parental mode. Now even the tricycle kid mode sucks too. Past 2yrs i had been thinking maybe my kid cudnt yet figure out to pedal until I see him riding his friend's tricycle(another brand) with such an ease. Even other kids cudnt pedal who were well pedaling their own tricycles. They all say its 'hard' to pedal. Such a waste of money. It looks brand new post 3yrs n of no use. Highly disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddler
customer_reviews.text: Our 1-year-old loves riding on his trike and watching the world around him. We use this instead of his stroller when we think he'll stay awake for a walk. He really enjoys it. I appreciate the telescoping handle. My husband greased the wheels a little and it rides much smoother now. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: Cute but really hard to assemble! The storage case on the handle of a bicycle is not sustainable and will fall off on its own
customer_reviews.author: Mother devil of four angels

customer_reviews.title: Cute Tricycle
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice tricycle for kids. Has seat belts to prevent them from slipping off and a canopy shield them from the sun and rain. It'll be nice if it came with bell so the kids can alert others that they're coming. They do need to add a function to lock in the steering wheel. It gets extremely difficult to maneuver when the kids determined to steering towards a certain direction.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great little trike
customer_reviews.text: Love the design of this trike for my daughter, she’s 13 months. Took a star off of sturdiness because my son (2) stands on the rear cubby, despite my pleas to not, and it pops backwards far too easily. Also the parent tray fell off a while back and it hasn’t been missed (it’s very easy to put back on, I just haven’t). Not important to the operation of the trike, so we still love going on walks with it now.
customer_reviews.author: Mark R. White

customer_reviews.title: Hard to steer
customer_reviews.text: Was not a fan of this trike for a couple of reasons. 1. Not easy to put together. 2. Didn’t like the steering of the trike. Hard to keep trike straight. 3. Quality seem to be OK for the trike just the parent handle was flimsy. My son did love riding in the trike. If you don’t mind the hard steering, it’s not a bad trike for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Sverdlow

product_meta.title: Little Tikes Perfect Fit 4-in-1 Trike, Pink
product_meta.description:
Color:PinkThe Perfect Fit 4-in-1 Trike is ready to grow with your child! With all of the features of your favorite stroller, this trike is not only a perfect fit for your child – it's a "perfect fit" for parents too! This advanced trike makes on-the-go travel easy with multiple storage spots! From parents pushing, to toddlers learning to pedal, to them starting to steer, and then going on their own, this trike keeps pace with your active, growing child. Stage 1-Stroll (9+ months) Parents to push and control-When the foot platform is installed, the child will be unable to reach the pedals Stage 2-Pedal (18+ months) Toddlers can learn how to pedal, child is unable to turn the wheel Stage 3-Learn (24+ months) Remove the waist bar, child can steer while parent still has control with the push bar Stage 4-Trike (30+ months) Remove the push bar to let kids go on their own with parent supervision Product Features: • Pink 4-in-1 trike to grow with your child from stroller to trike • Full shade canopy to protect child from all angles • High-back seat for comfort and safety • Adjustable seat with the flip of a switch • Full foot platform fully protects little feet • Large parent storage bucket and bottle holder • Safety-bar with cup/snack holder • Ages: 9+ months
